results.name: Surface area of n-dimensional sphere of radius r is n*V_n*r^(n-1) = n*Pi^(n/2)*r^(n-1)/(n/2)! = S_n*Pi^floor(n/2)*r^(n-1); sequence gives numerator of S_n.
comment: Answer to question of how to extend the sequence 0, 2, 2 Pi r, 4 Pi r^2, 2 Pi^2 r^3, ...
Volume of n-dimensional sphere of radius r is V_n*r^n - see A072345/A072346.
Denominator of the rational coefficient of integral_{x>0} exp(-x^2)*x^n. - _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 23 2013

More generally, the ordinary generating function for the surface area of the n-dimensional sphere of radius r is 2*x*(1 + exp(Pi*r^2*x^2)*Pi*r*x + exp(Pi*r^2*x^2)*Pi*r*erf(sqrt(Pi)*r*x)*x) =  2*x + 2*Pi*r*x^2 + 4*Pi*r^2*x^3 + 2*Pi^2*r^3*x^4 + (8*Pi^2*r^4/3)*x^5 + Pi^3*r^5*x^6 + ... (End)
